nodes.bodyText:
When the SimpleStreetSplitter is in destructiveSplitting mode (during graph construction rather than handling routing requests), it removes edges that have been split and can then re-split the resulting segments, so parts of them are also removed. New edge fragments are added to the spatial index; the edges that were split are removed (disconnected) from the graph but not removed from the spatial index, so for the rest of the linking and splitting operation we must check whether any edge coming out of the index has not been "soft deleted".
I think all of this is compensating for the fact that STRTrees are optimized at construction and read-only, so you can't remove things from them once they're built. That's no longer relevant since we've been using our own hash grid spatial index instead of the STRTree for a while. I think we can turn this check into an assertion, then change the method that removes the edges so it also removes them from the index.
